item.title: Whispers, wishful thinking and credibility
item.description: IN BANGLADESH’S political history, many things have returned from the dead, military strongmen, discredited doctrines, recycled promises. But one idea that stubbornly refuses to survive contact with reality is the recurring prediction that Jamaat-e-Islami is on the brink of state power. This idea has now been revived not through electoral arithmetic or grassroots......Political science books

item.title: Regulating ultra-processed foods
item.description: FOR generations, the people of this region, including Bangladesh, have been sustained by the quiet strength of a traditional diet rooted in simplicity and balance. Steamed rice, fresh river fish, lentils, seasonal vegetables and abundant water formed more than daily meals; they constituted a system of care, cultural continuity and nutritional resilience. That food culture......

item.title: LDC graduation and unfinished business of clean energy
item.description: AS BANGLADESH marks the International Day of Clean Energy this January, the observance arrives at a moment of unusual historical weight. In November this year, the country is set to graduate from the United Nations’ list of Least Developed Countries. This transition is widely framed as a marker of success — a recognition of economic growth, improved infrastructure......Bangladesh travel guides

item.title: Parole decisions must not be arbitrary
item.description: THE denial of an under-trial prisoner’s parole application to attend the funeral of his wife and only son has raised questions about legal reforms as the decision reflects an indifference towards prisoner’s rights. The family of the the under-trial prisoner on January 24 submitted an application for parole to the Bagerhat jail to attend the funeral of his wife and......

item.title: Weak enforcement marks start of electioneering
item.description: ELECTORAL campaigns for the national elections, scheduled for February 12, began on January 22 to run until February 9. This is for the first time that the election authorities have banned the use of posters and hoardings. But candidates contesting the elections, even from major political parties, appear to have been unwilling to go by the rule. Colourful posters of candidates......
